intro: Pavetta sumbawensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy texture, giving it the "pubescens" variety name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
